alert.note: Alert for Eastern Plymouth; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Plymouth County through 345 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plympton, or near Bridgewater, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and torrential rainfall. This storm has a history of producing frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Poor drainage flooding and minor ponding on roadways. Locations impacted include... Brockton, Bridgewater, Middleborough, Pembroke, Rockland, Whitman, Hanover, East Bridgewater, Kingston, Carver, Hanson, Halifax, West Bridgewater and Plympton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
